tasks.task: Follow biosecurity protocols when transporting livestock.
subtasks: Identify designated farm entry points.
Contact farm for admittance procedures.
Inspect and clean trucks and trailers.
Adhere to farm-specific entry procedures.
Verify paperwork (CVI, brand inspection, bill of lading, bill of sale).
Check cleanliness of footwear and coveralls.
Ensure trailers are clean before loading.
Examine and load animals, avoiding sick or injured ones.
Confirm loaded animals' paperwork and numbers.
Work with producers on animal separation and monitoring.
Clean trailers after unloading.
Check for certificates of veterinary inspection.
Verify brand inspections for livestock like cattle.
Confirm bill of lading details.
Validate bill of sale information.

tasks.task: Adapt entry procedures at different farms.
subtasks: Obtain necessary phone numbers for farm admission.
Follow indicated entry routes specified by the farmer.
Record entry and exit information as required.

tasks.task: Transport livestock without spread of diseases.
subtasks: Clean trucks to remove mud or manure.
Use designated cleaning facilities if required.
Inspect trailers for cleanliness before loading.
Use clean bedding on trailers.
Escort loaded animals through the specified route.
Confirm animal numbers and classes at unloading.
Address sick animals promptly upon arrival.
Move contaminated transportation equipment to a clean area.
Contact state animal health officials for CVI requirements.
Adhere to state-specific brand inspection policies.

tasks.task: Execute proper loading and unloading practices.
subtasks: Examine animals during loading.
Communicate with the producer during unloading.
Inspect transported animals for sickness during unloading.
